executive_summary: Kickboxing studios have enjoyed strong growth over the current period despite the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020 hammering kickboxing studios. Social distancing measures prevented kickboxing studios from practicing. Nonetheless, following the reopening of the economy and vaccine rollouts, pent-up demand led to solid growth in 2021. Still, kickboxing studios did not fully recover because of the difficulty in gaining back customers they had lost. Nonetheless, growth in total recreation expenditure enabled kickboxing studios to recover over the current period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The outbreak of COVID-19 hammered kickboxing studios
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Kickboxing studios faced considerable declines in 2020 as lockdown mandates fully shut kickboxing studios for much of the year. Social distancing measures made in-person group classes impossible.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Pent-up demand led to a strong recovery
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pent-up demand following the reopening of the economy and vaccine rollouts led to considerable growth for kickboxing studios in 2021, though not fully recovering from pandemic-induced lows as some studios faced difficulties gaining back customers they lost.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growth will accelerate over the outlook period for kickboxing studios.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Considerable growth in total recreation expenditure over the outlook period will bolster growth. Strong growth in disposable income over the outlook period will prop up growth and induce consumers to take more expensive personal training sessions, potentially increasing profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: The rise in popularity of cardio kickboxing will present an opportunity for kickboxing studios.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Cardio kickboxing focuses on fitness instead of teaching techniques and sparring like traditional kickboxing studios. Nonetheless, kickboxing studios offering cardio classes will enjoy an uptick in business from new demographics that generally would not be very interested in traditional kickboxing.

industry_definition: Kickboxing studios train individuals in kickboxing by teaching various techniques in group and private classes. Kickboxing studios host matches and often sell sports-related equipment like wraps, gloves and protective gear.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: The outbreak of COVID-19 led to considerable declines. Still, pent-up demand as the economy reopened led to solid growth for kickboxing studios.

Growth will ramp up over the outlook period. Climbing disposable income will increase the number of consumers taking more expensive private training sessions. Surging total recreation expenditure will also promote growth.

market_segmentation.segment_description: These markets comprise consumers under the age of 18. Kickboxing studios have dedicated classes for children, contributing to this market comprising a considerable share of revenue.

Many consumers in the 18 to 24 age group often continue training in kickboxing through adulthood, either after competing or continuing to compete. Younger consumers are also less hindered by potential injury and strain on the body and use kickboxing as a form of exercise while also learning a skill.

Many consumers in the 18 to 24 age group often continue training in kickboxing through adulthood, either after competing or continuing to compete. Younger consumers are also less hindered by potential injury and strain on the body and use kickboxing as a form of exercise while also learning a skill.
These markets comprise consumers under the age of 18. Kickboxing studios have dedicated classes for children, contributing to this market comprising a considerable share of revenue.

Potential injury dissuades some consumers aged 35 to 44 from practicing kickboxing. Many consumers in this age group prefer taking cardio kickboxing classes, focusing more on fitness than learning techniques and sparring.

Potential injury dissuades some consumers aged 45 to 54 from practicing kickboxing. Many consumers in this age group prefer taking cardio kickboxing classes, focusing more on fitness than learning techniques and sparring.
Potential injury and other health concerns contribute to these markets comprising the smallest revenue share.
Potential injury and other health concerns contribute to these markets comprising the smallest revenue share.

products_and_services.product_description: Memberships give consumers access to group training. Group training within kickboxing involves organized classes or sessions where a range of practitioners, spanning from novices to more experienced students, practice collectively under the supervision of an instructor.

Personal training and instructional programs in kickboxing comprise individualized, one-on-one sessions involving a practitioner and an instructor. Private training often focuses on students' weaknesses to help them improve their game.
Other products comprise merchandise and other sport-related equipment. Kickboxing studios often sell shorts, t-shirts, wraps, gloves, shin guards and other protective gear to their students.

tier_1_suppliers: Athletic & Sporting Goods Manufacturing in the US
Commercial Real Estate in the US
Vitamin & Supplement Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Martial Arts Studios in the US
Gym, Health & Fitness Clubs in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Differentiation is the primary barrier to entry. Start-up costs are moderate, legal hurdles are low and many studios are nonemployers, but it may be difficult to attract students if an established studio exists in an area.
Solid growth and falling wage costs have led to modest profit expansion. The increasing number of nonemployers has led to wages falling as a share of revenue, pushing profit.

Kickboxing studios have faced higher rental costs. As many retailers leave shopping malls and look to establish in strip malls, rent prices for kickboxing studios have climbed amid competition for space.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Differentiation is the primary barrier to entry. Start-up costs are moderate, legal hurdles are low and many studios are nonemployers, but it may be difficult to attract students if an established studio exists in an area.

basis_points.basis_title: External competition from martial arts and exercise classes
basis_points.basis_description: Kickboxing studios face various forms of external competition. Other martial arts like boxing and karate are substitutes for kickboxing. Also, exercise classes, like spin classes, are a source of external competition as consumers often use kickboxing as their exercise.

Kickboxing studios face moderate buyer and supplier power. Buyers' ability to compare the price of studios to other neighboring studios and the instructors' reputation is a source of power. The price and breadth of coverage insurance companies will provide are sources of supplier power.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Market share concentration is low among kickboxing studios. Most kickboxing studios are nonemployers, limiting the potential accumulation of considerable market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Climbing rental costs for kickboxing studios
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As various retailers flee malls because of low foot traffic and sought-out spaces at strip malls, rent prices have climbed. This influx in demand for space at strip malls has led to climbing prices and hiking rental costs for kickboxing studios that are typically established in these locations.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patents and concentration of patents
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is experiencing a low level of both the rate of new patents and the concentration of patents in the industry. This creates an environment where the threat of new technologies driving disruption is low.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The major markets for this industry are highly concentrated, which implies that the market has a focus on key customer segments. This presents an opportunity for strategic entrance into lower-end markets or unserved markets for innovations to take on a disruptive trajectory.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in participation in sports have induced volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Given that kickboxing is considered a sport, participation in sports impacts volatility. Participation in sports fell following the outbreak of COVID-19 in 2020, contributing to considerable declines. Following the reopening of the economy, vaccine rollouts and pent-up demand, participation in sports surged, leading to a massive increase in revenue in 20201.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Various Factors Contribute to Memberships Comprising the Largest Market
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Memberships give consumers access to group training. Group training within kickboxing involves organized classes or sessions where a range of practitioners, spanning from novices to more experienced students, practice collectively under the supervision of an instructor. Group training is often much less expensive than private training, contributing to the dominance of this segment. The social aspect of training in a group also encourages expenditure on this segment.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Price of Personal Training and Instructional Programs Bolsters This Segment
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Personal training and instructional programs in kickboxing comprise individualized, one-on-one sessions involving a practitioner and an instructor. Private training often focuses on students' weaknesses to help them improve their game. Private training is often much more expensive than paying a studio monthly for group classes, pushing up the segment's share of revenue. Consumers looking to improve their kickboxing skills often pay a premium for these services.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Various Factors Push Up the Sale of Other Services
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Other products comprise merchandise and other sport-related equipment. Kickboxing studios often sell shorts, t-shirts, wraps, gloves, shin guards and other protective gear to their students. Customers will often purchase merchandise and other sport-related equipment for a sense of community at their gym and to support the owner. Also, the sport-related equipment is often high quality and customized.

FAQs.question: What are the regulation and policy levels for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The text indicates LOW regulation and STEADY regulation for this industry.

FAQs.question: What is the level of industry assistance?
FAQs.answer: The text indicates LOW assistance and STEADY assistance for this industry.

FAQs.question: What key financial data is provided for this industry?
FAQs.answer: The text provides annual data from 2005 to 2014 on revenue, industry value added (IVA), number of establishments, number of enterprises, employment, exports, and wages for this industry. It does not provide data on imports or domestic demand.
